Detailed Description

C++ composite abstract class.

Member Function Documentation

virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::bindAsynchronous ( const char *  name,
unsigned int  size,
NMF::Composite *  target,
const char *  targetname,
unsigned int  subpriority = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Bind asynchronously two components together.

Bind a required interface of a client component with a provided interface of a server component via a asynchronous binding.

Warning:
In order to save memory, we are not embedding description about interface type, thus we are not able to detect mismatch of interface types during binding.
Exceptions:
NMF_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE 
NMF_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE 
NMF_NO_MORE_MEMORY 
NMF_INTERFACE_ALREADY_BINDED 
Parameters:
[in] name The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] size The number of element in the event fifo (number of simultaneously waiting request).
[in] target The server component instance handle.
[in] targetname The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] subpriority The sub-priority belonging the priority of the target component
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::bindComponent ( const char *  name,
NMF::Composite *  target,
const char *  targetname 
) [pure virtual]

Bind synchronously two components together.

Bind a required interface of this client component with a provided interface of a server component.

Note:
Either synchronous (with at least one method returning parameter) or asynchronous interface could be bind by such method.
Warning:
Creating such binding break the execution model by making synchronous call which could be reentrant. Thus use this method with many precaution for example only with state-less server library.
In order to save memory, we are not embedding description about interface type, thus we are not able to detect mismatch of interface types during binding.
Exceptions:
NMF_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE 
NMF_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE 
NMF_INTERFACE_ALREADY_BINDED 
Parameters:
[in] name The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] target The server component instance handle.
[in] targetname The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::bindFromMPC ( t_nmf_component_handle  client,
const char *  clientitfname,
const char *  compositeitfname,
unsigned int  size 
) [pure virtual]

Bind a composite sub-component (ARM or MPC) from a MPC component deployed through CM API.

Parameters:
[in] client Client MPC component handle
[in] clientitfname Client MPC component require interface name
[in] compositeitfname The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] size The number of element in the event fifo (number of simultaneously waiting request).
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::bindFromUser ( const char *  name,
unsigned int  size,
NMF::InterfaceReference *  reference,
unsigned int  subpriority = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Bind asynchronously the User to the component.

Create a asynchronous binding between the User and the server component.

Exceptions:
NMF_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE 
NMF_NO_MORE_MEMORY 
Parameters:
[in] name The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] size The number of element in the event fifo (number of simultaneously waiting request)
[out] reference The interface descriptor reference
[in] subpriority The sub-priority belonging the priority of the target component
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::bindToMPC ( const char *  compositeitfname,
t_nmf_component_handle  server,
const char *  serveritfname,
unsigned int  size 
) [pure virtual]

Bind a composite sub-component (ARM or MPC) to a MPC component deployed through CM API.

Parameters:
[in] compositeitfname The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] server Server MPC component handle
[in] serveritfname Server MPC component provided interface name
[in] size The number of element in the event fifo (number of simultaneously waiting request).
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::bindToUser ( t_nmf_channel  channel,
const char *  compositeitfname,
void *  clientContext,
unsigned int  size 
) [pure virtual]

Bind asynchronously the component to the User.

Create a asynchronous binding between client component and the User.

Exceptions:
NMF_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE 
NMF_NO_MORE_MEMORY 
NMF_INTERFACE_ALREADY_BINDED 
Parameters:
[in] channel The channel where the user will retrieve callback to execute.
[in] compositeitfname The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] clientContext The client context that will be given back to user when calling EE_GetMessage()
[in] size The number of element in the event fifo (number of simultaneously waiting request)
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::construct ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Construct a composite network.

Instantiate a new composite network.

virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::destroy ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Destroy a composite network.

Destroy a previously instanciated component with construct by freeing memories allocated for component instance. This component must been previously stopped using stop.

virtual t_nmf_component_handle NMF::Composite::getComponentInterface ( const char *  compositeitfname,
char *  realitfname 
) [pure virtual]
Parameters:
[in] compositeitfname MMDSP component name inside this composite component.
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::getInterface ( const char *  name,
NMF::InterfaceReference *  reference 
) [pure virtual]

Bind synchronously the Host to the component.

Create a synchronous binding between the User and the server component.

Note:
Either synchronous (with at least one method returning parameter) or asynchronous interface could be return by such method.
Warning:
Using the interface descriptor reference returned by this method break the execution model by making synchronous call which could be reentrant. Thus use this method with many precaution for example only with state-less library.
Exceptions:
NMF_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE 
Parameters:
[in] name The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[out] reference The interface descriptor reference
virtual t_nmf_component_handle NMF::Composite::getMPCComponentHandle ( const char *  nameinowner  )  [pure virtual]

Get a component instance of a component instantiate on MPC.

This method allow you to get a component instance of a component instantiate automatically by this composite. This reference could be used to create sub-binding (like tunneling) with other MPC components (either obtain by this method on other composite or directly instantiate using Component Manager.

Note:
Potential created sub-binding must be unbound before destroying the composite.
Returns:
NULL if component not exist or if not instantiate, elsewhere return the component handle
Parameters:
[in] nameinowner MMDSP component name inside this composite component.
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::getProperty ( const char *  name,
char *  value,
t_uint32  valuelen 
) [pure virtual]

Get a component property declared in ADL.

Exceptions:
NMF_NO_SUCH_PROPERTY 
Parameters:
[in] name The component property path-name (sub-component's/attribute)
[out] value Address where putting property value
[in] valuelen value length
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::readAttribute ( const char *  name,
t_uint32 *  value 
) [pure virtual]

Read a value on an attribute exported by a component instance.

This attribute must have been declared as an attribute in the component configuration file.

Exceptions:
NMF_NO_SUCH_ATTRIBUTE 
Parameters:
[in] name The component attribute path-name (sub-component's/attribute)
[out] value Read value
virtual void NMF::Composite::start ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Start a composite network.

Start a component which has been fully configured and which has all required interfaces binded.

Note:
Start/stop is recursive, thus you can start multiple time same component, but you have to stop same number of time.
virtual void NMF::Composite::stop ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Stop a composite network.

Stop a component previously started using start.

Note:
Start/stop is recursive, thus you can start multiple time same component, but you have to stop same number of time.
virtual void NMF::Composite::stop_flush ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Stop a composite network and flush all pending messages.

Stop a component previously started using start and flush all pending messages.

Note:
Start/stop is recursive, thus you can start multiple time same component, but you have to stop same number of time.
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::unbindAsynchronous ( const char *  name,
NMF::Composite *  target,
const char *  targetname 
) [pure virtual]

Unbind asynchronously two components together.

Unbind a required interface of a client component with a provided interface of a server component via a asynchronous binding.

Exceptions:
NMF_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE 
NMF_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE 
NMF_INTERFACE_NOT_BINDED 
Parameters:
[in] name The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] target The server component instance handle.
[in] targetname The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::unbindComponent ( const char *  name,
NMF::Composite *  target,
const char *  targetname 
) [pure virtual]

Unbind synchronously two components together.

Unbind a required interface of this client component with a provided interface of a server component.

Exceptions:

NMF_NO_SUCH_PROVIDED_INTERFACE 
NMF_INTERFACE_NOT_BINDED

[in] target The server component instance handle.
[in] targetname The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::unbindFromMPC ( t_nmf_component_handle  client,
const char *  clientitfname,
const char *  compositeitfname 
) [pure virtual]

Unbind a composite sub-component (ARM or MPC) from a MPC component deployed through CM API.

Parameters:
[in] client Client MPC component handle
[in] clientitfname Client MPC component require interface name
[in] compositeitfname The server provided interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).

Exceptions:

Parameters:

virtual t_nmf_error NMF::Composite::unbindToUser ( t_nmf_channel  channel,
const char *  compositeitfname,
void **  pClientContext 
) [pure virtual]

Unbind asynchronously the component to the User.

Destroy a asynchronous binding between client component and the User.

Exceptions:
NMF_NO_SUCH_REQUIRED_INTERFACE 
NMF_INTERFACE_NOT_BINDED 
Parameters:
[in] channel The channel where the user will retrieve callback to execute.
[in] compositeitfname The client required interface name (either collection or not collection name allowed).
[in] pClientContext A reference where returning the client context gived during bind
